content.description: Climb 3 bolts of .10- terrain, then head left up the beautiful arete.  A series of bouldery moves leads to a long throw to a jug.  Stays on you to the anchors.  Low-tide route, the bottom gets some ocean spray at high-tide.
content.location: In the large corridor, just past Riptide on your left.

content.description: Alternating climbing between delicate, balancy sequences and a few burly moves... namely the crux, which features a huge height dependent throw through the overhang.

Excellent, slightly under-vertical climbing on well-featured stone.  Tide-dependent, the bottom 2 bolts get ocean spray at high tide.  About as an aesthetic position for a climb as you'll find anywhere.
content.location: On the west face, scramble around the left side if coming from the Main Wall.  Basically on the ocean.

content.description: Clip the first bolt of Plague Of Flies with a sling, then head leftward briefly. Sustained, 11a! Very, very good! Links back into the anchor of Plague Of Flies.
content.protection: 8 bolts. CLIP THE FIRST WITH A SLING.
content.location: Just left of Plague Of Flies

content.description:
Direct finish to Ebb Tide. After the fourth bolt, head left up the overhang with some nice sequences (including a tough to decipher crux at the 6th bolt). A second crux involves a thin crimp rail shortly after. Good climbing!

The route originally went all the way to the Ebb Tide anchor, with a 5.2 solo up the slab, but there was too much rope friction at the lip. I've added a new anchor at the lip. Currently, there are two bolts from the original iteration of the route that I plan to chop and patch.
content.location: Right of Reality Check, same shared start as Ebb Tide

content.description:
Start as for Lord Of The Flies, but after the second clip, continue heading off left for a rising traverse that lands you at a belay on the top of the boulder. Belay your follower up, then rappel off of either Ebb Tide or Prom Date.

This route traverses far over the ocean, which is spectacular, but also makes it impossible to do a standard toprope setup, hence why where is no anchor at the lip. After belaying on the summit, it's really nice to walk around up there and enjoy the unique position. It is also a fantastic way to set up a TR on Labor of Loathe, Reality Check, or Prom Date.
Climb scar past a drilled angle.
content.protection: bolt/fp used to get to flattop to gain access for numerous TR's we set up way back when . . .

content.description: Step off the nice, flat boulder and pull through some reachy jugs as you head rightward over the sea. After pulling the tricky bulge, head left on a tip-toe slab. You really want to clip the last three bolts with slings! I'll probably move the 9th bolt left at some point.
content.protection: 10 bolts. CLIP THE LAST THREE BOLTS WITH SLINGS!!
